snippet: The prevalence of diabetes has been rising in rich countries for several decades, largely driven by increases in the rate of obesity. More recently, poorer countries have begun to follow the trend.
abstract: Study published in British medical journal The Lancet reports sharp rise in global rate of Type 2 diabetes, which is related to obesity and has historically been prevalent in wealthy countries; study highlights major shift in deaths in developing world, away from communicable diseases and toward chronic illnesses like cancer and diabetes.
lead_paragraph: The prevalence of diabetes has been rising in rich countries for several decades, largely driven by increases in the rate of obesity. More recently, poorer countries have begun to follow the trend.

headline.main: Global Diabetes Rates Are Rising as Obesity Spreads
headline.print_headline: Global Diabetes Rates Are Rising as Obesity Spreads

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation
